column3: I have an application that needs to be signed through blockchain. It works by events by multiple users uploading a list of documents up to the infinite as an example below. ... #5 - Document A - User 4 #4 - Document B

column3: Food delivery apps
column4: Familiar with Cross native platform
column5: Native. All the food delivery function
column7: MerchantSome people can ask – why do I need to develop my application if there are already aggregators or popular services which I can use? Let's check out three categories of businesses that should consider developing a food delivery service:  Restaurant Chains: Owners of a large food restaurant chain across the city or country that don't want to pay an extra fee to some aggregator app. Entrepreneurs of a Specific Area: The location they live in is too small or distant for such aggregators like UberEats
column8: or they can't launch due to some legal issues.  Startups: Those who want to be ahead of direct competitors and by creating a food delivery service – increase the client's loyalty and break new ground.  Types of Food Delivery Apps Business models of food ordering platforms can adjust according to business goals and requirements. Food delivery service can be local or even worldwide
column9: giving multiple opportunities to start or extend the existing business.  Let's check out the typical business models of food delivery applicatCategoría: Programación y TecnologíaSubcategoría: Programación de Apps. Android

column3: Hello there. We are looking for a good and committed professional to build our project. Please
column4: we appreciate if you read all the informations above. And feel to make any questions by email
column6: or even a Skype talk. We are looking forward for a long period partner
column7: so it's important to doesn't matter how we go
column8: make a video call before any agreement
column9: anyways. That’s the resume of the project: KIOSKGO We need an app to make deliveries for Kiosks in Germany
column10: initially in Frankfurt with potential to expand the whole Germany.  Most of the sales will be around products like Beers
column13: Chips… Fast delivery for people in the streets or parks around the city and in their homes. The app is not exactly like a food delivery app
column14: because we will not have the list of the Kiosks (provider
column15: like a restaurant) in the Front App. The client will just choose the product in a single Catalog and buy it. But each Kiosk will have their own storage management. With this functionality we need some specific changes in the normal process. We are listing the buying route above tagging some particular specifications of our product.  Introduction: 1. We need the App for the Driver
column16: The Kiosks and the Front app for the Costumers. 2. The App will have one single catalog of products with categories and just us
column17: the administrators will manage the front catalog. 3. The Kiosks (providers) that are registered on the App
column18: will be able to select the products that we have in the App Catalog and than select the amount of storage they have for each product in their own storage. 4. The storage of the Catalog will come from the Kiosks. 5. So
column20: the Kiosks control the storage they have of our products. 6. If any of the Kiosks have some of the products
column21: the product will disappear from the front-end Catalog. Buying Process: 1. The Customer opens the app and chooses the products
column22: add in the cart and finalize the purchase.  2. The App will calculate first wich Kiosk gonna have all the products for that order
column23: and the Kiosk needs to accept the order in his app
column24: let's suppose in 1 minute maximum. 3. If the Kiosk don't accept the order
column25: the App will calculate the next closest Kiosk. 4. If none of the Kiosks have all the products at once
column26: the App will calculate the order with 2 or maximum 3 Kiosks in a radius of 5km and divide the orders according to the storage (we need to able to control this functions). 5. Example: 1 Kiosk have 3 beers + Cigarette
column27: and the second closest Kiosk have the Wine. 6. After the Kiosks accept the order
column28: the App will search the closest Drivers and the offers the order
column29: the first Driver wich accept the delivery will get the order. 7. The Driver will drive to the first (or only) Kiosk
column31: apply the withdraw in the App and drive to the next Kiosk to get the other products. And activate the delivery process for the Customer. 8. Emergency: It can happens that the Driver gets in the Kiosk and the Kiosk with the approved order says that he dont have the product anymore
column32: so there must be a button of Emergency
column33: that will make the App recalculate new Kiosks with the storage
column34: and the Kiosk that missed the order will be blocked until we unblock it on the system. 9. After the Driver confirmed the withdraws
column35: the Customer will receive the new time delivery process "Delivering". 10. After the delivery
column36: the Driver confirm it and the order its done.  Needs and Observation: 1. All the processes will be kept into our system
column37: where the administrative can check in a Desktop panel or website. 2. Extra information: When the client finishes the purchase process if there is a cigarette or alcohol in the cart it will be necessary to insert an ID verification. We need to check for a German api of id card
column38: use as a reference: https://www.tabak-brucker.de/zigaretten-online-kaufen 3. * Besides the api of the id german card
column39: the user should be able to upload a photo of an document (check the page) 4. *Extra step in the delivery process: When the Driver delivers the pack
column40: he asks for the ID card or document for comprove
column41: and he can have the possibility to takes a photo of it in the last step of the delivery. The ID card will be attached in our system with the client who made the purchase. 5. We need to have a central administrator user to control all the purchases and to know how much we need to pay for each Kiosk every week or 2 weeks
column42: we need to able to control that. 6. We need someone who can be present and with a good contact for support afterwards. 7. The Driver need to have a full register with a photo in the app
column43: and uploaded documents for verification in our side. 8. We need to be able to control the distance in Kms for the Kiosks and delivery rate. 9. We need to rate the users of the app in each step. So when the Driver withdraw the order he just select 1 to 5 stars for the Kiosk. When the client receive the delivery he can evaluate 1 to 5 stars for the driver.Categoría: Programación y TecnologíaSubcategoría: Programación de Apps. Android
